content.raw:
Correct, these are the types currently handled. It just occurred to me that we should be able to construct widgets for all other types though, if we decompose their messages down to the lowest components. I'll give that a try.

As for getting the strings, the `msgs::ConvertGeometryType` function currently helps with that. I think it wasn't used here because we wanted to pick and choose the supported types. When I address the point above I might be able to use it.
content.html:
Correct, these are the types currently handled. It just occurred to me that we should be able to construct widgets for all other types though, if we decompose their messages down to the lowest components. I'll give that a try.

As for getting the strings, the msgs::ConvertGeometryType function currently helps with that. I think it wasn't used here because we wanted to pick and choose the supported types. When I address the point above I might be able to use it.
